title: BBC Local Live: Leeds and West Yorkshire on Friday 4 March 2016 - BBC News
summary: snow across west yorkshire brings schools closures , delays on buses .
police release cctv of man after eight-year-old girl assaulted in greggs .
bus tours aim to entice new teachers to bradford schools .
'i do n't fear sack ' , says leeds united manager steve evans .
michael vaughan urges boycott to 'back down ' in yccc board wrangle .

documents.title: goodbye : our live coverage across the day
text: thanks for being with us today , i hope we 've been able to keep you up to date with what 's been happening across the county .
we 'll be back at 08:00 on monday with more news , travel , sport and weather .
we 've seen a lot of people have lots of fun in the snow today , like these below in oxenhope
but , as the snow turns to that slushy stuff in the centre of our towns and cities , i leave you with this of leeds from charles heslett , who asks : `` was it all just a dream ? ''
author: Nick Wilmshurst
BBC Local Live, Leeds

documents.title: thirty-four men charged over violent brawl at leeds council-run bangladeshi centre
text: police have charged 34 men over a mass brawl that erupted during a meeting at a council-owned community centre in leeds .
author: Yorkshire Evening Post

documents.title: twenty-seven arrested in major calderdale drugs operation
text: `` this will not be tolerated ' '' - that 's the defiant message from west yorkshire police after suspected drug dealers in halifax were targeted in a major operation .
author: Halifax Courier

documents.title: weather : sleet and slow easing tonight bright day tomorrow
text: tonight will be cloudy with outbreaks of rain and sleet and snow slowly sinking south as it fragments .
temperatures dropping to freezing in places with brisk northerly winds .
tomorrow it will be brighter , but still with the risk of a few showers .
feeling cold with a maximum temperature of 6c ( 43f ) .
author: Keeley Donovan
BBC Look North

documents.title: latest headlines : merged yorkshire police force 'inevitable ' and snow causes disruption across county
text: here are the latest headlines in west yorkshire this afternoon :

documents.title: m62 crash : one man taken to hosptial
text: just had some more information about the crash at j22 on the m62 , a man has been airlifted to hospital after being involved in a crash .
no other vehicles were involved .

documents.title: bradford bus tours to entice teachers to city
text: trainee teachers are being given bus tours of schools in bradford in a bid to help tackle a recruitment crisis .
students on teacher training courses in west yorkshire are taken around primary schools to meet staff and children to entice them to work in the city .
one of the tours was scheduled to take place today , but was cancelled because of the snow .
bradford is a challenging place to work but it 's also exciting . ''

documents.title: boss evans does not fear leeds united sack
text: leeds united boss steve evans says he does not fear for his job despite just one win in the championship club 's last 11 league games .
evans was advised by the club 's chairman massimo cellino not to talk to the media after monday 's 4-0 defeat by brighton & hove albion .
`` i 100 % have to believe that i am going to be here in the summer , '' the 53-year-old told bbc radio leeds .

documents.title: yorkshire cricket : geoffrey boycott should 'back down ' - michael vaughan
text: former england captain michael vaughan has urged geoffrey boycott to `` back down '' on twitter .
boycott is attempting to rejoin the board of county champions yorkshire .
boycott wants to stand for election at the club 's annual general meeting .
he spoke to bbc look north earlier in the week .
come on @ twitterid back down this is doing nothing for our great club
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid we 're back to back champions .
do n't need this nonsense pre season for 2016
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid if you actually wanted to `` do good '' for @ twitterid you 've have spoken to him privately instead
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid michael , you have his number so why do n't you call him to discuss , not on twitter
@ twitterid when will boycott realise it 's not about him !
@ twitterid @ twitterid thought he was simply standing for election and free voting - denison seems to think he should decide ?
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid sounds like it 's mr guy spouting the most , not geoffrey himself ?
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid guy is right .
paying lip service only to members , lenders control club
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid what club sends me a voting form telling me all candidates ok but do n't vote boycs ?
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid surely denison is the one causing the problem by trying to affect a free vote ?
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid i hope all parties think what is best for the club in this matter .
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid but sir geoff is yorkshire ?
this sounds like financial hypocrisy
@ twitterid @ twitterid do n't need this bickering , it 's a big year for the club , surrey & lancs will be gunning hard for us time
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid something must be done , if not @ twitterid then who fix yorkshire ?
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid what 's your solution to the financial situation michael ?
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid disagree michael the club have made a mountain out of a mole hill
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid who are you to interfere vaughan

documents.title: travel update : accident on m621 and leeds outer ring road closed due to flooding
text: this is n't good news at rush hour either , the a6120 outer ring road in leeds is closed eastbound between woodside roundabout and the black moor road junction , because of flooding .
we 've also had news of an accident on the m621 eastbound in leeds between j2 ( a643 elland road ) and j2a ( cemetery holbeck ) .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: m62 crash scene being cleared - but delays still expected
text: this is better news after the multi-vehicle accident - but we can still expect delays on the m62 during rush hour i 'm afraid .
fire crews have now left the rtc on # m62 wbound j23-j22 by scammonden water .
just 1 lane still closed wbound causing traffic delays .

documents.title: girl , eight , sexually assaulted in a greggs in leeds
text: an eight-year-old girl was sexually assaulted while sitting in a bakery , police have said .
the girl was in greggs at the headrow in leeds with her mother and brother when she was assaulted while her mother was stood at the counter .
police have released cctv images of a man [ above ] they want to trace in connection with the assault , which took place at about 15:30 on 12 february .

documents.title: latest headlines : snow causes widespread disruption and huddersfield man appears in court on terror charge
text: here are the latest headlines for west yorkshire so far today :

documents.title: west yorkshire snow : the mystery beast of horsforth ?
text: can you help alison , who posted on the horsforth community group page on facebook .
she spotted these animal tracks in hall park , but what creature would make these kind of marks in the snow ?
guesses so far include reindeer , a gremlin and a kangaroo !
the favourite so far is a squirrel though .
email us your thoughts

documents.title: west yorkshire snow : todmorden , it 's under there somewhere
text: here 's another from molly greenwood , it seems that todmorden has disappeared under a blanket of snow !

documents.title: west yorkshire snow : 'thank you for your patience '
text: if you were travelling with transdev this morning , they 've sent you a little thank you note !
thankyou-to all our customers for your patience following a very difficult am peak.. @ metrotravelnews

documents.title: travel update : m62 westbound j23 accident
text: we 've got a multi-vehicle accident on the westbound m62 between j23 ( a640 huddersfield ) and j22 ( a672 rishworth moor ) , the weather conditions are n't helping either .
this is j25 westbound ( you can just about see it through the water on the lens ) .
there 's very much a queue , i 'd avoid if you can .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: watch : school 's open for business - but there 's still fun in the snow
text: more than 80 schools in west yorkshire are closed because of the snow - but that means most of the county 's schoolchildren still had to make their way to lessons this morning .
some made sure they did n't miss out on the fun at break time though
no excuses for the kids of scapegoat hill school near # huddersfield , lessons as normal but playtime in the # snow

documents.title: snow forces postponement of 2016 keighley business awards launch
text: the snowy conditions forced organisers of this year 's keighley business awards to postpone a launch event due to take place this afternoon .
author: Keighley News

documents.title: west yorkshire snow : do n't slip in the gully at headingley !
text: can you believe the county championships start here next month ?
so glad we play our fixtures in july/august !
# shinebright-er !
@ twitterid will be great to bring my lad to see you play at headingley .

documents.title: weather watchers narnia ? no , leeds actually
text: our weather watchers around west yorkshire have been busy snapping away .
i suppose because there 's quite a bit of weather to watch !
earlier we showed you a pic of horsforth that the sender said looked like narnia .
well here 's another , looks like it 's straight out of the lion , the witch and the wardrobe .
want to become a weather watcher ?
you can sign up here .

documents.title: travel update : m62 j22 queues eastbound
text: not quite sure why , but there seem to be queues eastbound on the m62 at j22 .
let us know if you know why
author: BBC Travel

this is the current of j23 near huddersfield

documents.title: spare a thought for harry and paul
text: it 's less than a week until look north 's harry gration and paul hudson start their three counties , three-legged walk for bbc sport relief .
they 'll be walking more than 110 miles tied together at the ankle .
it 's hard enough to walk three-legged at the best of times , but snow and ice wo n't make things very nice at all .
if this weather carries on , i do n't think we 're going to have much fun ``
the walk starts in rotherham next thursday morning and the first day finishes with a special edition of look north from outside barnsley town hall .
we 'll keep you updated here on local live .
you 'll also be able to follow how they get on on social media .
if you can spare a few pounds , click here to donate ( we 'd be really grateful ! )

documents.title: watch : gritter 's eye view of a snowy night in the pennines
text: i 've often wondered what sort of conditions greet the gritters when they 're out .
major respect for keeping that huge truck pointing in the right direction !
a gritters eye view from last night up at wessenden head road and a635 greenfield road .

all gritting crews were moved to a a 24/7 rota yesterday evening and they will be out on the roads all day today .

text: leeds bradford airport has just opened the runway again .
if you 're flying out from there today , it 'd be worth checking before you head off .
but any delay has to be worth the sunshine you 'll probably get at the other end !

documents.title: west yorkshire snow : weather could lengthen run of cancelled games
text: it 's not looking good for liversedge fc 's home game with worksop town tomorrow .
can you believe they 've had to call off every home game for the last four months !
looks like tomorrow 's fixture is in doubt now as well
so the weather gods conspire against us again !

or make any sort of allowances ?
it 's getting ridiculous

author: Dave Fletcher
BBC West Yorkshire Sport

documents.title: good morning : our ( snowy ) live coverage
text: does n't it look pretty out there !
welcome to our live feed for today , which of course , will be mainly dedicated this morning to the dumping of snow we 've had overnight .
we 'll keep you updated with all the latest weather , travel news and school closures too , until 18:00 .
just a word of warning , make sure you get the right shoes on this morning
i did n't , and now my feet are cold .
also , you can send in your snowy by email and we 'll feature them !
author: Nick Wilmshurst
BBC Local Live, Leeds
